q_en: For orders submitted by PolyU in January 2024, set all sewing tasks for producing Red, M size type T-shirts to start status.
gt:
Sure thing! Let's break down the task and see what we have:

### Task Overview
We need to set all sewing tasks for producing **Red, M size T-shirts** to "start" status for orders submitted by **PolyU** in **January 2024**.

### SQL Query Results
Here's a summary of the relevant IDs we found:

| Description | ID |
|-------------|----|
| Customer ID for "PolyU" | 1 |
| Order ID for January 2024 | 1 |
| Product ID for "Red, M size T-shirt" | 1 |
| Order Product ID | 1 |

### Next Steps
With these IDs, you can proceed to update the sewing tasks to "start" status for the specified order and product. ğŸ‰

If you need any more help or have further questions, feel free to ask! ğŸ˜Š

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'PolyU';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "PolyU"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = '1' AND created_at BETWEEN '2024-01-01' AND '2024-01-31';
steps.description: Retrieve the order IDs for orders submitted by the customer "PolyU" in January 2024

steps.sql: SELECT p.id FROM products p JOIN products_types pt ON p.products_type_id = pt.id WHERE p.attributes = 'Red, M size' AND pt.description = 'T-shirt';
steps.description: Retrieve the product ID for the product with attributes "Red, M size" and type "T-shirt"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN (1) AND product_id = '1';
steps.description: Retrieve the order_product IDs for the specific orders and product
